segment.source: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM
segment.target: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM

segment.source: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM
segment.target: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM

segment.source: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM
segment.target: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM

segment.source: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool is a command-line tool that enables the creation of Windows® image (.wim) files for deployment in a manufacturing or corporate IT environment.
segment.target: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool is a command-line tool that enables the creation of Windows® image (.wim) files for deployment in a manufacturing or corporate IT environment.

segment.source: The /Append-Image option appends a volume image to an existing .wim file allowing you to store many customized Windows images in a fraction of the space.
segment.target: The /Append-Image option appends a volume image to an existing .wim file allowing you to store many customized Windows images in a fraction of the space.

segment.source: When you combine two or more Windows image files into a single .wim, any files that are duplicated between the images are only stored once.
segment.target: When you combine two or more Windows image files into a single .wim, any files that are duplicated between the images are only stored once.

segment.source: Multiple Windows Images in a .wim file
segment.target: Multiple Windows Images in a .wim file

segment.source: Before you can append data to an image, you must have the following:
segment.target: Before you can append data to an image, you must have the following:

segment.source: A technician computer running Windows 8 or a technician computer with the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) tools installed on it.
segment.target: A technician computer running Windows 8 or a technician computer with the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) tools installed on it.

segment.source: A Windows image (.wim) file.
segment.target: A Windows image (.wim) file.

segment.source: For more information about how to capture an image using DISM, see Capture Images of Hard Disk Partitions Using DISM.
segment.target: For more information about how to capture an image using DISM, see Capture Images of Hard Disk Partitions Using DISM.

segment.source: To append a volume image to an existing image
segment.target: To append a volume image to an existing image

segment.source: Open a command prompt with administrator privileges.
segment.target: Open a command prompt with administrator privileges.

segment.source: If you are using a version of Windows other than Windows 8, navigate to the DISM directory.
segment.target: If you are using a version of Windows other than Windows 8, navigate to the DISM directory.

segment.source: Append a volume image to an existing image.
segment.target: Append a volume image to an existing image.

segment.source: For example, you can append an image of the D drive to an existing image called my-windows-partition.wim.
segment.target: For example, you can append an image of the D drive to an existing image called my-windows-partition.wim.

segment.source: Next Steps
segment.target: Next Steps

segment.source: You can apply the image by referring to it by image number or image name, for example:
segment.target: You can apply the image by referring to it by image number or image name, for example:

segment.source: You can extract the image into a separate file by using the /Export-Image option.
segment.target: You can extract the image into a separate file by using the /Export-Image option.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
